+ You can have a relationship with most of your companions (yes fangirls, you can have a love interest) 

Cons: 
- Poor graphics (I don't think graphics really matter anyway) 
- Awkward love scenes 
- Invisible walls 
- One mission was boring, in my opinion, but everyone has different tastes 

Neutral: 
+- The protagonist you create can't talk; whether that's good or bad depends on personal preference. 

My thoughts: I love this game. This is probably one of the best RPGs or games in general I've ever played. If you're an RPG fan, you probably already have this game.

original: Yes, this is a nostalgia trip for thirty-somethings who remember (at least in the uk) watching the ever-irritating timmy mallet just for the five minute transformers cartoon. The voice actors for optimus, megatron, bumblebee, and many others are back, and instantly recognisable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cell-shaded presentation is perfect, and very, very generation one. But aside from that, it's actually a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often a necessity, and woven seamlessly into combos, making it quite unlike high moon's excellent war for/fall of cybertron games. Another distinction is the heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies (e.g. Seekers) require a switch to a ranged blaster.
polished: Yes, this is a nostalgic trip for thirty-somethings who remember watching the ever-irritating Timmy Mallett (at least in the UK) just for the five-minute Transformers cartoon. The voice actors for Optimus, Megatron, Bumblebee, and many others are back and instantly recognizable. The distinctive cartoon transformation sound is there. Graphically, the cel-shaded presentation is perfect and very, very Generation One. Aside from that, it's a very fun game. The combat mechanics are extremely well done. Transforming mid-fight is often necessary and seamlessly integrated into combos, making it quite different from High Moon's excellent War for/Fall of Cybertron games. There's a heavy focus on melee combat, but some enemies require a switch to a ranged blaster.

original: So i downloaded the game and played it for a little while, and it was nothing special. I spent more time trying to log in though than actually playing the game. There is a bug where it says that there was an update to the terms of service or whatever and whenever you clicked 'accept' it would just pop up again. You have to restart the client for it to work. Now that isn't that bad but why do i need to link my steam and gface accounts? they say it is for dlc but why is that even necessary? it is also not reversable so now i know that a company i don't care about has access to my steam information. Now the game itself is so so. It is easily recognisable as a cod clone, except somehow they made the gunplay worse... How is that even possible?
polished: I downloaded the game and played it briefly, and it felt quite ordinary. I spent more time trying to log in than actually playing. There's a bug where, after an update to the terms of service appears and you click 'accept', the prompt just returns. You have to restart the client for it to function properly. While that's not too severe, why must I link my Steam and Gface accounts? They claim it's for DLC, but is that really necessary? It's irreversible, so now a company I don't care about has access to my Steam information. The game itself is average. It's clearly recognizable as a COD clone, but somehow, they've made the gunplay worse. How is that even possible?

original: 4k+ at 60fps (gtx 970), dual audio options and includes neptune gear. What's not to love? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo excellent port and a great entry point if new to the series. Just keep in mind there is lots of (skip-able) talking. As usual would suggest using a gamepad but personally i had no problems with a keymouse/mouse setup, both completely rebindable. Price is about right and wouldn't have been unhappy about a purchase. More then half the dlc is included free, which is still plenty to play with. Recommended game to all jrpg/anime/visualnovel fans, provided you don't mind long breaks between the action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_
polished: 4K resolution at 60fps (GTX 970), dual audio options, and includes Neptune gear—what's not to love? Check out the excellent port at this link: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nygsb617tmo. It's a great entry point if you're new to the series. Be aware there’s a lot of dialogue that can be skipped. Using a gamepad is recommended, though I had no issues with a keyboard/mouse setup, both fully rebindable. The price feels fair, and I wouldn't have regretted purchasing it. Over half the DLC is included for free, providing plenty to enjoy. Highly recommended for JRPG/anime/visual novel fans, as long as you don't mind breaks between the action. Cheers. No commentary playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=plslfvijaupszez9af395mvnk63xnhsj1_

original: I experienced no performance problems even at release, and after all these patches it plays really well. Imo, this is a really great and fun game in truth, although the format may be somewhat annoying (where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story). I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments (where you can play batman + 1 more), and the ability to use the controller for most segments of the game but the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving your batmobile around the free-roam city, including when chasing the apc commanders, is actually quite enjoyable once you figure out how to use the breaks to skid around corners (and when you master that, driving around the city is really quite enjoyable!)
polished: I experienced no performance issues even at release, and after all these patches, it plays exceptionally well. In my opinion, this is a truly great and fun game, although the format can be somewhat annoying, where the free-roam city area repopulates with new enemies every time you progress the story. I particularly enjoyed the 'dual play' segments, where you can play as Batman and another character. Using the controller for most parts of the game, and the mouse and keyboard for the tank combat segments was greatly appreciated. Driving the Batmobile around the free-roam city, especially when chasing the APC commanders, is quite enjoyable once you master skidding around corners.

original: Damn fine aaa fps shooter - that's the bottom line. It's looks, sounds and plays great - great fps mechanics, nice story, cool characters, flawless voice acting, and a badass soundtrack. Not for the faint hearted though - some of those cutscenes were pretty darn cruel and vivid. But when a game overall is so great, it's easier to spot the flaws, and here they are as i saw 'em: - no sli support - wtf? i had to put the game away until i upgraded my card, as it ran too poorly on my old dual gpu gtx 590. Make sure you have a fairly decent single gpu card. - stupidly small obstacles are often unclimbable.
polished: This is an excellent FPS shooter—impressive in every way. It looks, sounds, and performs exceptionally well: engaging FPS mechanics, a compelling story, intriguing characters, flawless voice acting, and an outstanding soundtrack. It's not for the faint-hearted, though—some cutscenes are quite intense. When a game is this great overall, its flaws become more noticeable. Here's what stood out to me: - No SLI support, which was disappointing. I had to wait until I upgraded my card, as it struggled on my old dual GPU GTX 590. Ensure you have a decent single GPU card. - Annoyingly small obstacles are often unclimbable.

original: English is not my native language. I am dutch. So please ignore any typing/grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review in a few categories: - graphics - controls - sound - gameplay - replayability - graphics: the game has been set in a comic-like style. The graphics are very slick: no unnecussery details. Nice colour-scemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 pentium processor, with nvidia geforce 710m card - 8gb memory and it runs like clockwork (windows 8.1). - controls: the game can be played with keyboard and mouse, but also with an x-box controller.
polished:
English is not my native language. I am Dutch, so please forgive any typing or grammatical mistakes in my review of this fantastic game. I will break down this review into a few categories: graphics, controls, sound, gameplay, and replayability.

Graphics: The game is designed with a comic-like style. The graphics are very sleek with no unnecessary details and feature nice color schemes. It totally works for this game. The graphics can be set on 'high' without stressing your system. I run this game on an i5 Pentium processor with an NVIDIA GeForce 710M card, 8GB memory, and it runs like clockwork (Windows 8.1).

Controls: The game can be played with a keyboard and mouse or with an Xbox controller.

original: You can see by the hours i put into this game that i enjoy it. This is everything i wished a search game from cod would be. But dont buy this game thinking its like cod, battlefield, or any other shooter game. Its a game in its own class and should be treated as such. Cant tell you how many times i hear new players ♥♥♥♥♥ and complain about getting killed really fast. Oh god forbid you get shot in the face and ♥♥♥♥ing die. It's not like that doents happen in real life or anything. Edit:ok so ive been playing this game for awhile now. Thrown all kinds of money at it. One of the best mp games around. A good thing to play when your your not feeling cs:go.
polished: You can see by the hours I've put into this game that I enjoy it. This is everything I wished a search game from CoD would be. But don’t buy this game thinking it's like CoD, Battlefield, or any other shooter game. It's a game in its own class and should be treated as such. I can't tell you how many times I hear new players complain about getting killed really fast. Oh, heaven forbid you get shot in the face and die. It's not like that doesn’t happen in real life or anything. Edit: I've been playing this game for a while now. I've invested a lot in it. One of the best multiplayer games around. A good choice when you’re not in the mood for CS:GO.

original: I'm 2 hours in and am dying from this game. So funny. Gameplay is also solid, art design is beautiful, music is surprisingly high quality and appropriate, the story/world has me interested, and the puzzles are fun. But the best thing about this game beyond all that is the comedy. If you've played any rpg since the dawn of video game rpgs you will laugh at the various jokes, parodies, and references; if you've never played an rpg before then you should still enjoy the game for its humor. If you played final fantasy 7 or x you absolutely need to play this game, without giving too much away... I had to actually stop playing after 2 hours to give my cheeks a break from laughing and smiling so much. What a delight so far.
polished: I'm two hours in, and this game is hilarious. The gameplay is solid, the art design is beautiful, and the music is surprisingly high quality and fitting. The story and world have captured my interest, and the puzzles are enjoyable. The standout feature is the comedy. If you've played any RPG since the genre began, you'll appreciate the jokes, parodies, and references. Even if you're new to RPGs, you'll find the humor entertaining. If you've played Final Fantasy VII or X, this game is a must-play. Without giving too much away, I had to stop after two hours to rest my cheeks from all the laughter and smiles. What a delight!

original: I'm really sorry, i try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but i really didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded right up my alley, but the execution has done nothing for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but i found this game to be completely unintuitive, and even after looking up how to progress i still just simply didn't find the gameplay itself fun. It also completely lacks a pause button, or if it does have one i never found it. Considering that a lot of sequences in the game are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. I also feel like this game is a lot more cut scene than it is game, and i end up just sitting around drumming my fingers a lot.
polished: I'm really sorry. I try to be supportive of free-to-play games and indie developers, but I didn't enjoy this game. The description sounded appealing, but the execution didn't work for me. I love puzzle and exploration games, but I found this one completely unintuitive. Even after searching for guidance, I didn't find the gameplay fun. It also lacks a pause button, or if there is one, I couldn't find it. Considering that many sequences are timed, this seems like a critical oversight. Additionally, this game feels more like a series of cut scenes than gameplay, leaving me just sitting around, drumming my fingers.

original: This game.... Phew where to even start. It was absolutely beautiful, from story to graphics i was hooked. The story wasnt just some story but actually felt like i was that person, trying to figure out what came next in the story that my character was telling. Gameplay was great and i learned alot about myself through this game (mainly my fear of hights which i never had a problem with until the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but i kept through for uncle fred! if you guys made a dlc or second game, i would be the first to buy it and recomend it to everyone i know. Thanks to everyone who was involved making this, you made a absolutely beautiful game.
polished: This game... Phew, where to even start? It was absolutely beautiful. From the story to the graphics, I was hooked. The story wasn't just any story; it felt like I was the character, trying to figure out what came next. The gameplay was excellent, and I learned a lot about myself through this game (especially my fear of heights, which I discovered in the ice caverns). My gut churned the whole time, but I persevered for Uncle Fred! If you guys made a DLC or a sequel, I’d be the first to buy it and recommend it to everyone I know. Thanks to everyone involved in making this; you created an absolutely beautiful game.

original: Sid meier's civilization beyond earth is a turn-based game in which you build your civilization to a certain goal or 'victory'. In previous games you were set on the earth's timeline going through periods like the stone age, medieval age, and the modern age; however, in this game you are set in the future on a mission to colonize a new planet. What i enjoy about this game is 2k took a new approach to the game and added some new mechanics such as the affinity system and orbital layer. What i didn't enjoy was that with these new mechanics the game could be overwhelming at times. What think could be improved on this game is that they could maybe incorperate some new artwork in the game such as the enviroment you experience when communicating with another leader.
polished: Sid Meier's Civilization: Beyond Earth is a turn-based game where you build your civilization to achieve a specific goal or "victory." Unlike previous games where you progressed through Earth's historical eras like the Stone Age, Medieval Age, and Modern Age, this game is set in the future, focused on colonizing a new planet. I appreciate that 2K took a fresh approach with new mechanics, such as the affinity system and orbital layer. However, these additions can sometimes make the game feel overwhelming. One area for improvement could be incorporating new artwork, particularly in the environments encountered during interactions with other leaders.

original: Great game ! tons of replayability and very fun zombie survival game ! def. In my top 5 zombie games ever played. Edit: after playing 60+ hours i can honestly say this is one of the better more ''realistic'' zombie games. It's very much designed like a survival horror as you must save up your ammo, heal your own wounds when you bleed out, take pills when youre infected, etc. Also, i find zombies to feel very natual to be well animated for a free to play game. P.s. : i would recomend getting 1 or 2 friends to play with, but the community is super friendly and you can usually make friends/talk with the people in the chat or over voice comms.
polished: Great game! Tons of replayability, and a very fun zombie survival experience! Definitely in my top 5 zombie games. Edit: after 60+ hours of playing, I can honestly say this is one of the better, more "realistic" zombie games. It's designed as a survival horror—you must conserve ammo, heal your wounds, and take pills if you're infected. I find the zombies well animated for a free-to-play game. P.S.: I recommend playing with 1 or 2 friends, but the community is super friendly, and you can usually make friends or chat with people through voice comms.

original: 02/07/2014 - it's a shame i can't thoroughly recommend/enjoy this game as from the short time i've played it,i know i'd be addicted if it didn't have the following 2 game breakers. . No aussie servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage,and creates unbearable lag. Mind you,i played through the offline training mode and it was stuttering/lagging as well (how does that even happen?). Couple that with the poor ping,and it just ruins the game. . Everything artifacts like crazy - the menu's,backgrounds,training and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my oc. Set my gpu back to stock and sure enough,it didn't make a difference.
polished: 02/07/2014 - It's a shame I can't thoroughly recommend or enjoy this game. From the short time I've played it, I know I'd be addicted if it didn't have two major issues. No Australian servers - one red bar puts you at a severe disadvantage, creating unbearable lag. Mind you, I played through the offline training mode, and it was stuttering or lagging as well. How does that even happen? Coupled with the poor ping, it just ruins the game. Everything artifacts like crazy - the menus, backgrounds, training, and in-game. I've never had this happen before with this card and thought it might not like my overclocking. Set my GPU back to stock, and sure enough, it didn't make a difference.

original: Very late last night i finished this. The story is not very deep or interesting but what makes it stand out is the story-telling. The atmosphere is filled to the brim and the many collectibles do a great job at fleshing it out. I did learn a lot about the world of batman so it was a little disappointing that so few bosses were in the game. Oh well, there's enough future games to rectify that. The combat is the right amount of challenge but it's more on the easy side. Leveling up batman wasn't very satisfying. It's the gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign which add for nice new gameplay mechanics. Getting access to previously unreachable places makes for a nice sense of progression.
polished: Late last night, I finished this. The story itself may not be very deep or captivating, but the storytelling truly stands out. The atmosphere is rich, and the numerous collectibles do an excellent job of fleshing it out. I learned a lot about the world of Batman, though I was somewhat disappointed by the limited number of bosses in the game. However, future games provide an opportunity to address this. The combat offers a suitable challenge, albeit leaning towards the easier side. Leveling up Batman was not particularly satisfying. The gadgets you upgrade and acquire during the campaign introduce enjoyable new gameplay mechanics. Gaining access to previously unreachable areas adds a pleasing sense of progression.

original: 'to the moon' is no mere game... Nay, it is a veritable experience, and it was one of the best of my life at that. Think telltale's the walking dead is sad? hohoho! well, it's no match for to the moon! never before have i been so depressed yet fulfilled over something purely fictional. This masterpiece represents the pinnacle of storytelling in my opinion, and the soundtrack is a gorgeously charming and perfect accompaniment. Yes, the controls are a bit finicky and the gameplay is not the strong point, but the story is so fantastic that i did not care one bit. Plus, the humor of the game is great as well and it definitely does not intrude upon the distinguished nature of the story... And the doctor who references are endless.
polished: To the Moon" is not just a game; it is a profound experience and one of the best of my life. Think Telltale's "The Walking Dead" is sad? It doesn't hold a candle to "To the Moon"! Never have I been so profoundly moved by something fictional. This masterpiece epitomizes storytelling, and the soundtrack is a beautifully charming accompaniment. Yes, the controls can be a bit tricky, and gameplay isn't its strong suit, but the story is so exceptional that I didn't mind. Additionally, the humor is delightful and doesn't detract from the story's distinguished nature. Plus, the "Doctor Who" references are endless.

original: Bastion is a bloody brilliant game, with a really great storyline. Set after some calamity happened, you start to rebuild on the bastion. There's quite a lot of choice in the game, with the choice of what to build to give you an advantage, what weapons to use and what power ups to have on those weapons as well as what drinks to use to give you a bonus effect. The art style and music in the game is fantastic, everything looks so colourful at times, who says the apocolypse has to be dull. Best of all, the game has narration based on what you, the player do. So if you end up picking up a weapon then switch it for another in the armoury, the narration would say something of you taking along the new weapon.
polished: Bastion is an outstanding game with an engaging storyline. Set in the aftermath of a calamity, you begin rebuilding on the bastion. The game offers numerous choices, including what structures to build for advantages, which weapons to use, and which power-ups and drinks provide bonus effects. The art style and music are superb, with vibrant visuals that defy the notion that the apocalypse must be dull. Most impressively, the game features narration that responds to your actions. For example, if you pick up a weapon and later swap it for another in the armory, the narration remarks on your choice of the new weapon.

original: I had originally bought this game in early development, when the only currency was spacebux, and there was no 'tech tree'. This was when the game was good. All of the guns at this point were equally overpowered, so there was no problems with imbalance; everyone could kill everyone at any time. Also, the game used to give you unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would think that for a game with 'bajillions of guns', they would at least give you more than 6 weapon slots and 3 loadouts before you have to pay to get more. At one point, i had about 3 pages worth of guns, and was planning on new ideas for more, because personally, that's where i found it fun.
polished: I originally bought this game during its early development, back when the only currency was spacebux and there wasn't a "tech tree." At this stage, the game was great. All the guns were equally overpowerful, creating no imbalance; anyone could defeat anyone at any time. Back then, the game offered unlimited gun slots and five loadouts. You would expect that a game boasting "bajillions of guns" would provide more than six weapon slots and three loadouts without additional cost. At one time, I had about three pages' worth of guns and was brainstorming new ideas for more because, personally, that's where I found it entertaining.

original: This game was a surprising gem. One often sees rave reviews of certain products that are often misleading. In this case, the reviews reflect the fun of this neat little game. It is an odd mix between a classic 2d platformer and an moba, and does it with style. I found myself enjoying characters that i wouldn't enjoy in other moba games. I had expected this trait to continue, but decided to give a melee tank a go anyway. I was pleasantly surprised with the outcome and ended up trying out more as they were unlocked from playing games. The art style and interface is oddly charming. As such, i now use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.
polished: This game was a surprising gem. Often, rave reviews can be misleading, but in this case, they genuinely reflect the enjoyment of this neat little game. It's an unusual blend of a classic 2D platformer and a MOBA, executed with style. I found myself enjoying characters that I wouldn't typically enjoy in other MOBA games. Despite my initial hesitations, I decided to try a melee tank. I was pleasantly surprised with the result and ended up trying more characters as they were unlocked through gameplay. The art style and interface are charming. Now, I use one of the characters as my avatar and a wallpaper from creating a card set for the game.

original: I just started playing, but i love this game. I put on my headphone and lose myself in the game for hours at a time. It's been awhile since a game has had that effect on me. The music sets the mood, the sound effects are right on, and the controls are perfect. I look forward to every combat, and they've optimized combat extremely well. I had my doubt about the navel combat system, but it is so much fun to lay waste to multiple fleets at a time! the only way to lose in this game is to fail to retreat. If the combat looks overwhelming just get outta there, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks, devs, for an awesome experience!
polished: I just started playing, and I love this game. When I put on my headphones, I lose myself in the gameplay for hours. It's been a while since a game has captivated me like this. The music sets the perfect mood, the sound effects are spot on, and the controls are flawless. I eagerly anticipate each combat encounter, and they've optimized combat very well. I had doubts about the naval combat system, but it’s so exciting to defeat multiple fleets at once! The only way to lose is to fail to retreat. If combat looks overwhelming, just retreat, regroup, and counter-assault. Thanks to the developers for an amazing experience!

original: The reboot of the devil may cry franchise has brought about many changes for the series, particularly for series’ protagonist, dante. While fans of the original series may be upset at the change to their beloved character, it’s certainly for the better; and this new game by ninja theory proves it. Dmc serves as the perfect point for newcomers to jump into the series. It shows the origins of an arrogant, cynical dante, and it chronicles his journey from cynicism to selflessness. Throughout, the game weaves a clear, narrative arc for the new dante, making him a compelling character to watch.image the story follows dante as he’s introduced into the corrupt world he willfully chose to ignore.
polished: The reboot of the Devil May Cry franchise has introduced many changes, particularly for the series’ protagonist, Dante. While fans of the original may be upset by the changes to their beloved character, it’s arguably for the better, as this new game by Ninja Theory demonstrates. DMC serves as the perfect entry point for newcomers. It explores the origins of an arrogant, cynical Dante and chronicles his transformation from cynicism to selflessness. The game weaves a clear narrative arc for this new Dante, making him a compelling character to follow. The story follows Dante as he is introduced to the corrupt world he once willfully ignored.

original: Where do i start on this absolutely beautiful game. It's story, is absolutely charming. It has so much detail put into it, and it is a bundle of happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, secrets. It is serious when it needs to be, but isn't a stranger to funny moments. The character design is on point, with there being various characters with various personailities and secrets to them. It sticks out from other rpg's because you don't have to kill anyone, which is an unused concept in rpg's. With lots of inspiration from earthbound, one of the best rpg's i have seen, you can tell that it is going to be good. It easily has the best soundtrack i've heard in forever.
polished: Where do I begin with this absolutely beautiful game? Its story is utterly charming, filled with detail, happiness, bad puns, annoying dogs, and secrets. It balances seriousness with humor seamlessly. The character design is outstanding, featuring a variety of personalities and hidden depths. This game stands out from other RPGs because you don't have to kill anyone, an uncommon concept in the genre. Drawing inspiration from Earthbound, one of the best RPGs I've experienced, it’s evident this game is exceptional. Additionally, it boasts the best soundtrack I've heard in a long time.

original: I am recommending this solely because it's free, and might be a more 'enjoyable' experience for others. As for my experience, the 'game' did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was not shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Maybe i'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to warrant a reaction out of me. As for the other half of the game, it tries to paint a picture (literally) of a person in mental decline. It deals with obsession, hallucination, depression and a few other things. In theory it is a cool idea. But the 'game' took me 10 minutes to complete, and that is with reading and taking in every little bit of information i could.
polished: I am recommending this solely because it's free and might offer a more enjoyable experience for others. As for my experience, the game did nothing for me. Half the story relies on shock factor. I was neither shocked nor emotionally moved in any way by this. Perhaps I'm desensitized, or maybe it was too simple to evoke a reaction from me. The other half of the game attempts to portray a person in mental decline, dealing with obsession, hallucination, and depression. In theory, it's a cool idea, but the game took me 10 minutes to complete, even with reading and absorbing every detail.

original: Do i even need to explain why portal is amazing? portal is a puzzle game, it gives you a concept then gets out. It is an amazing way to test your mind while still being fun. Although this game isn't as story heavy, it did give birth to one of the most good popular games of 2011. I still play this game and beat it when i am feeling bored and i love to come back and to see what gave birth to a legend and what is a legend. Gameplay: portal's gameplay is quite simple, to explain at least. You use portals to your advantage, along with buttons that activate a part of the puzzle. Two buttons are in the game, one that you press and one that you need a cube to put on.
polished: Do I even need to explain why Portal is amazing? Portal is a puzzle game that presents you with a concept and then lets you explore it. It’s an excellent way to challenge your mind while still having fun. While the game isn't heavily focused on story, it did pave the way for one of the most popular games of 2011. I still play and complete it when I'm bored, and I love revisiting the game to see what laid the foundation for a legend. Gameplay: Portal's gameplay is quite simple to explain. You use portals to your advantage, combined with buttons that activate parts of the puzzle. There are two types of buttons: one you press and one that requires a cube.

original: If you can overlook the bugs (which i personally only had two: one minor and the other quite annoying) edit: both bugs are resolved one fix increased my fps from 60-90 to 80-120 and are looking for a space exploration game, i can definitely recommend this. Since most of these reviews are about specs, i'll include mine: i5 6600k (~200€) radeon rx480 (~200€) z170 pro - gaming (~150€) 16gb ddr4 ram (~70€) ~650€ is definitely within the medium price range though, granted, this rig is quite new. Almost constant 60+ fps on high settings vsync enabled i genuinely can't believe 90% of the comments saying they're rocking an overkill setup and get 20fps.
polished: If you're able to overlook the bugs (I personally encountered two: one minor and the other quite annoying—edit: both bugs are resolved), and are seeking a space exploration game, I can definitely recommend this. Since most reviews discuss specifications, I'll include mine: i5 6600k (~€200), Radeon RX480 (~€200), Z170 Pro - Gaming (~€150), 16GB DDR4 RAM (~€70). ~€650 is certainly within the medium price range, though this rig is quite new. It achieves almost constant 60+ fps on high settings with V-Sync enabled. I find it hard to believe that 90% of the comments claim to have an overkill setup and get only 20 fps.

original: Remember age of mythology? yeah, it's been that long since there's been an rts game of such quality. Divinity: dragon commander reaches awfully close to these borders of my personal most favourite rts game. Combine this with a huge risk-like grand strategy mode and there, it hit the spot. I am not (read: try not to be) overly biased due to the fact that this game allows you to turn into a dragon, aiding your troops by supporting, attacking and even commanding unit production, direction and spawning at the very same time. Honestly, i do like the complicated rts games nowadays. Think of civ v and so on. However, such games attempt to cram complex mechanics, charts and resources all into one complicated game mode.
polished: Remember Age of Mythology? It's been quite a while since we've seen an RTS game of such quality. Divinity: Dragon Commander comes remarkably close to my personal favorite RTS. It combines a grand strategy mode reminiscent of Risk, hitting the spot perfectly. I try not to be overly biased, even though this game allows you to transform into a dragon, supporting your troops by attacking and commanding unit production and direction simultaneously. Honestly, I appreciate complex RTS games today. Think of Civilization V, for instance. However, such games often cram intricate mechanics, charts, and resources into a single, complicated mode.

original: Undertale comes together to make something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title and the music is nice, but paired together they make some truly beautiful and impacting moments. The script runs the gammut from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, and does this while turning rpg tropes on their head. And all of this without touching on the world, characters, story, gameplay... I could write whole pages about it. But instead, i'll just say this: if you like rpgs, play this game. If you like video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your death, play this game.
polished: Undertale comes together to create something greater than the sum of its parts. The graphics are solid for a retro title, and the music is beautiful; together, they create truly impactful moments. The script ranges from comedic to dramatic to heartbreaking to hopeful, sometimes all at once, while cleverly subverting RPG tropes. And all of this is without even mentioning the world, characters, story, and gameplay—I could write entire pages about it. Instead, I'll just say this: if you like RPGs, play this game. If you enjoy video games, play this game. If you have seven free hours between now and your final breath, play this game.

original: If you liked witcher 1 and 2, witcher 3 is must to get. I would give normally for this game 10/10 but unfortunatly after 1.03 this game turned into buggy ♥♥♥♥ + random crashes, so remember to save really often. When i played version 1.00 -> 1.03 my game never crashed, i didnt see any bugs. Also i have noticed that after 1.03 patch drawing distance sometimes is horrible, starting to draw objects when youre really close, sometimes even people. But if forgetting all these bugs, crashes and drawdistance 'bugs', this is really fantastic game, they made huge effort on quests, some of them really emotional and deep, lots of side quests, and the fact that your decision effects a lot in this game. I have played over 50 hours now and still going on.
polished: If you enjoyed Witcher 1 and 2, Witcher 3 is a must-have. Normally, I would rate this game 10/10, but unfortunately, after update 1.03, it became buggy with random crashes, so remember to save often. During version 1.00 to 1.03, my game never crashed, and I didn't encounter any bugs. After the 1.03 patch, I've noticed the drawing distance can sometimes be terrible, with objects and even people appearing only when you're very close. Despite these bugs and crashes, this is a fantastic game. They put tremendous effort into the quests, some of which are really emotional and deep, with numerous side quests. Your decisions have significant impacts in this game. I've played over 50 hours and am still going strong.

original: I have only had this game for a few months, but in just that short amount of time, two dlc's have come out, along with patches that have made an already great game into an excellent one. The devs are very active in the community, and it really shows in the various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a fairly steep learning curve to the game's mechanics of which i am still trying to learn; however, this breadth of strategy allows you a myriad of ways to reach goals and take advantage of certain situations. The game, in my mind, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself sucked into every session i play regardless of how the play-through is going.
polished: I've only had this game for a few months, but in that time, two DLCs have been released, along with patches that transformed an already great game into an excellent one. The developers are very active in the community, as evident in various discussion forums and dev diaries. There is a steep learning curve to the game's mechanics, which I am still trying to master; however, this extensive strategy provides numerous ways to achieve goals and capitalize on situations. The game, in my opinion, is almost infinitely replayable. I find myself completely engaged in every session I play, regardless of how the playthrough is progressing.

original: Warframe is a fun game for the first few hours of play. After those few enjoyable hours you'll begin to see that the only thing left the game has to offer is repetition in it's combat, enemies and game play. The one major high point for the game is that the developers are working hard and do semi-frequent updates that generally include a lot of content from sweeping changes to some of the game's systems, new warframes and other tweaks/features. It's a good game to play casually. Though i doubt it will hold your attention beyond a few months unless you just really like grinding. The upside to all of this is that the game is free so i'd recommend trying it out. If you're looking for a quick fix, try it out.
polished: Warframe is enjoyable for the first few hours. Afterward, you'll notice that what remains is repetitive combat, enemies, and gameplay. However, the developers actively update the game with substantial content changes, new warframes, and other features. It's a good game for casual play, though it might only capture your interest for a few months unless you particularly enjoy grinding. The significant advantage is that the game is free, so I recommend giving it a try. If you're seeking a quick gaming fix, it's worth exploring.

original: This game is so.. Very.. Boring. I bought this game because i believed it was a pc version of 'katamari damacy', a popular and nice ps 2 game. Sadly it's far from it. In this game you go about, absorbing ever bigger things to grow bigger and absorb bigger things. But the gameplay isn't as smooth as it could be, the levels not inventive and what is in it is a surreal horror show. I don't mean an entertaining horror show but, one that makes you rather depressed and rethink whether being alive is all it should be. Every 'living' creature in this game from small pets to human beings makes me wonder if the creators of this game had an interest in taxidermy.
polished: This game is very boring. I purchased it thinking it was a PC version of 'Katamari Damacy,' a popular PS2 game. Sadly, it falls short. You go around absorbing increasingly larger objects to grow bigger, but the gameplay lacks smoothness, and the levels aren't inventive. Instead, it presents a surreal horror show—not the entertaining kind, but one that leaves you feeling depressed, questioning if life is what it ought to be. Every creature, from pets to humans, makes me wonder if the creators had an interest in taxidermy.

original: Alright. Let me explain a few things, as a person very intrested in politics, i was very interested in this game when i first heard about it. I thought, 'oh wow! a simulator of the road to becoming president! that sounds fun!' well, it really wasn't. The game starts you off and says you need to pick a side: republican or democrat, there is no independent, or third party. A little dissapointed, but still optimistic, i carried on to see what i could do. I will give the game credit, the character customization, although limited, is pretty fun to mess around with. It's the only time its an option to wear your head or not in a campaign. Literally.
polished:
Certainly, let me provide a polished version with the required changes:

Alright. Let me explain a few things. As someone deeply interested in politics, I was eager to try this game when I first heard about it. I thought, "Oh, wow! A simulator of the road to becoming president! That sounds fun!" Unfortunately, it wasn't. The game starts by asking you to pick a side: Republican or Democrat. There's no option for independent or third party. A bit disappointed but still optimistic, I continued to explore what I could do. I must give the game credit; the character customization, although limited, is quite enjoyable to experiment with. It's amusing that it's the only time it's an option to wear your head or not in a campaign.

original: Fallout 3 story was better. Settlements get in the way of the story to the point you'll hate baby sitting them instead of playing the story. Some keys are hard coded and cannot be rebound. Bugs galore. My pipboy disappeared permanently at one point and had to research console commands to get it back. You don't have to work for power armor it's basically given to you from the beginning of the game and power cores are everywhere in trader shops. Value of power armor diminished greatly from previous fallout games. Story is medicore, everything about this game is mediocre except it doesn't crash every 10 mins like fallout 3. Very stable compared to fallout 3. Is it better than fallout 3 no. Is it better than new vegas? no. This title was so overhyped for how bad it actually is.
polished: The story of Fallout 3 was superior. Settlements interfere with the narrative to the point where you'll end up resenting managing them instead of engaging with the story. Some keys are hardcoded and can't be reassigned. The game is riddled with bugs. At one point, my Pip-Boy vanished permanently, and I had to research console commands to retrieve it. Power armor is essentially handed to you at the start, with power cores readily available in trader shops. This significantly devalues power armor compared to previous Fallout games. The story is mediocre, as is the game overall, but it doesn't crash every 10 minutes like Fallout 3. It is far more stable in comparison. Is it better than Fallout 3? No. Is it better than New Vegas? No. This title was overhyped given how disappointing it truly is.

original: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hrs to get to the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 what i liked: - visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - story is not that great, but the ending (after the closing credits) kind of made me not regret so much spending my time playing this game what i disliked: - visuals in the last level are uninteresting - gameplay in the last level gets much harder making it become a frustrating experience of having to do a lot of things over and over again until you get it right - achievements are too hard. There are 13 (out of 15) that only less than 2,1% of players achieved!
polished: My stats (at the time of writing this review): - 8.6 hours to reach the end - 10 collectibles found out of 25 - zero achievements out of 15 What I liked: - Visuals up until the last level (ice caves) - The story isn't great, but the ending (after the credits) slightly redeemed my time spent on this game What I disliked: - The visuals in the last level were uninteresting - Gameplay in the last level became significantly harder, making it frustrating to repeat tasks until getting them right - Achievements are excessively difficult. Only less than 2.1% of players have achieved 13 out of 15 achievements!

original: Pros: +graphic cons: -bugs(especially the environment, you may get stuck or your shots may hit a invisible wall despite having clear line of sight of the enemy) -game is handholding/ babysitting you -dumb ai -enemies always seem to know where you are when you are spotted -godlike accuracy by the enemy which is frustrating like the first ghost warrior. -terrible checkpoints and saves. -boring story that i couldn't care less about will not recommend it unless its 90% off even then i find playing this game to be an extremely boring chore, just playing for the sake of finishing it to move unto the next game in my library. Considering the time i wasted on the first ghost warrior (which was equally boring and i feel liberated when i finished it), i probably won't play it until the end.
polished:
Pros: + great graphics    
Cons: - bugs (especially environmental issues, such as getting stuck or your shots hitting an invisible wall despite having a clear line of sight to the enemy)  
- the game feels like it is handholding or babysitting you  
- poor AI  
- enemies always seem to know your location once spotted  
- the enemy's accuracy is frustratingly high, similar to the first Ghost Warrior  
- terrible checkpoints and save options  
- uninteresting story that was hard to engage with  
I wouldn't recommend this game unless it's heavily discounted, even then, I find playing it a tedious chore. Finishing it just feels like a task to move on to the next game in my library. Given my experience with the first Ghost Warrior, I likely won't finish this one.

original: Review for 29/11/2015 do not buy this game, servers offline. You can't play. No compres este juego, servidores offline. No puedes jugar. While i could play it, i enjoyed it. As the song of the steve miller band...: go on take the money and run uh uh uhhh! go on take the money and run go on take the money and run go on take the money and run https://youtu.be/-wcfugcollu?t=54 --- english - 73 minutes playing the game omfg just an hour in this game! it's awesome! some guns are op and matchmaking it's sometimes unfair, but hey, bf3 it's worse matchmaking a newbie and the higher lvls players weren't real humans, you shot them in the face and nothing happens!
polished: Review from 29/11/2015: Do not buy this game; servers are offline, and you can't play. No compres este juego; los servidores están offline. No puedes jugar. While I could play it, I enjoyed it. As the Steve Miller Band song goes: "Go on, take the money and run." I spent 73 minutes playing the game. Just an hour in, and it's awesome! Some guns are overpowered, and matchmaking is sometimes unfair, but hey, in BF3, matchmaking is worse. New players matched with higher-level players weren't realistic; you could shoot them in the face, and nothing happened!

original: Who wouldn't want to wear a fez? :d this puzzle platforming game stars a little guy with a fez who goes around collecting little bits to form a cube and navigating through a fairly large branching map. This game is quite amusing and running through it to complete the game was quite a bit of fun. ^_^ it can become semi-frustrating if you want to get all the cubes and achievements though. To get all the cubes you'll need to crack codes that you'll have to decipher. These can take a few seconds or frustrate you into looking into a guide (*raises hand* i gave up. -_-). The guide, 'a complete guide to fez!!!'
polished: Who wouldn't want to wear a fez? This puzzle platforming game features a little character with a fez who explores, collecting bits to form a cube while navigating a large and branching map. The game is quite amusing, and progressing through it was a lot of fun. It can become semi-frustrating if you aim to collect all the cubes and achievements. To find all the cubes, you need to crack codes that require deciphering. These can be quick or so challenging that you might resort to a guide. I gave up. The guide, 'A Complete Guide to Fez,' is available for assistance.

original: It's not hard for me to see why other people like this game, but it wasn't for me. For one thing i have a vive and i'm much more interested in playing room sized games with the controllers. Beyond that, the game is initially awe inspiring in the scale of its universe, but i also felt that same scale was a hinderence to my enjoyment. The learning curve and the amount of time to do anything interesting at the beginning were both too large for me. Perhaps if i were more patient and had more time for gaming this would be compelling to me. But i don't have either and there are plenty more vr games i'd rather spend my time on.
polished: I can understand why others enjoy this game, but it wasn't for me. I have a Vive and am more interested in room-sized games using the controllers. The game's universe is initially awe-inspiring in its scale, but that scale also hindered my enjoyment. The learning curve and the time required to do anything interesting at the outset were both too steep for me. Perhaps if I were more patient and had more time for gaming, I would find it compelling. However, I lack both, and there are many other VR games I'd prefer to spend my time on.

original: Hands down my favorite first person shooter of all time. Run and gun rambos need not apply. Recoil and ballistics are realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle caliber weapons almost always result in death unless it just grazes you. Rounds drop over distance and short, controlled bursts are required if you wish to remain on target. There is no magical ammunition pool. If you reload half-way through your magazine all the time then you will have a pouch full of half full mags. You can't run forever. If you sprint for a while your aim will suffer as you gasp heavily until you have caught your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. Accuracy suffers when standing.
polished: Hands down, this is my favorite first-person shooter of all time. Run-and-gun players need not apply. The recoil and ballistics are realistic. Single hits to the chest, neck, or head from rifle-caliber weapons nearly always result in death unless they graze you. Rounds drop over distance, and short, controlled bursts are necessary to stay on target. There is no magical ammunition pool; if you reload halfway through your magazine frequently, you'll end up with a pouch full of half-full mags. You can't run indefinitely; sprinting too long affects your aim as you gasp heavily until you catch your breath. Rest your weapon on your elbows while prone or on a window sill to steady your aim. Standing accuracy suffers.

original: Let me start off by saying i did not purchase eu when it first came out and that i got it on sale which included ew so i never experienced the issues that some people claim to have had with that game. I loved that game however, it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when you did things right. As for xcom2 i love it, the game plays pretty well for me on medium and i am running a gtx560 with 2gb of vram. At first the game set it to high and it was running a bit sluggishly but not to the point of being unplayable but when i dropped it down to medium it smoothed on out. Not sure if i am just lucky when it comes to having issues with games or what but it seems that most of the negative reviews sound like they are coming from some really entitled people.
polished: Let me start by saying I did not purchase EU when it first came out; I got it on sale, which included EW, so I never experienced the issues some people reported. I loved that game; it was unforgiving in the early stages but rewarding when you succeeded. As for XCOM 2, I love it. The game plays well for me on medium settings, and I am using a GTX 560 with 2GB of VRAM. Initially, the game was set to high, and it ran a bit sluggishly, but not to the point of being unplayable. When I lowered it to medium, it smoothed out. I'm not sure if I'm simply lucky regarding game issues, but most negative reviews seem to come from some very entitled individuals.

original: +rpg levelling +wide-variety of ship types +physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missles +easy-to-learn resource management +dark humored -grind intensive (if under utilizing the civvy station types) -sub-par ai teammates -low variety of equipment types -low variety of levelling skills (that is, no branching) listen, this game is fun as hell. Despite my minuses up there, there is still some variety and strategy to be had. It starts off fast and still really picks up. Even though there's a low variety of equipment, it still feels like there's always another ship to unlock or skill to level up. The best way to increase the life of this game is the mods. Fight for universe is easily the star, but big fight for beef is also very good.
polished:
+ RPG leveling  
+ Wide variety of ship types  
+ Physics-based movement for both ships and projectiles/missiles  
+ Easy-to-learn resource management  
+ Dark humor  

- Grind intensive (if underutilizing civilian station types)  
- Subpar AI teammates  
- Low variety of equipment types  
- Low variety of leveling skills (no branching)  

Listen, this game is fun as hell. Despite my minuses, there's still some variety and strategy to be had. It starts off fast and really picks up. Even with a low variety of equipment, it feels like there's always another ship to unlock or skill to level up. The best way to extend the game's life is through mods. Fight for Universe is easily the standout, but Big Fight for Beef is also very good.

original: World leaders gather to face uncertainty more than 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe are arriving in the swiss mountain resort davos for the annual world economic forum (wef). For five days, they will discuss issues ranging from china's economic power to iraq's future after this sunday's elections. Uk prime minister tony blair and south african president thabo mbeki are among the more than 20 government leaders and heads of state leaders attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the wef are expected to be muted. Anti-globalisation campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The brazilian city of porto alegre will host the rival world social forum, timed to run in parallel with the wef's ritzier event in davos.
polished: World leaders gather amid uncertainty as over 2,000 business and political leaders from around the globe arrive at the Swiss mountain resort of Davos for the annual World Economic Forum (WEF). Over five days, they will discuss issues ranging from China's economic power to Iraq's future following this Sunday's elections. UK Prime Minister Tony Blair and South African President Thabo Mbeki are among more than 20 government leaders and heads of state attending the meeting. Unlike previous years, protests against the WEF are expected to be minimal. Anti-globalization campaigners have called off a demonstration planned for the weekend. The Brazilian city of Porto Alegre will host the rival World Social Forum, timed to coincide with the WEF's event in Davos.

original: Deadline nears for fiat-gm deal fiat and general motors (gm) have until midnight on 1 february to settle a disagreement over a potential takeover. The deadline marks the point at which fiat will gain the right to sell its car division to gm, part of an alliance agreed in 2000. Gm, whose own european operations are losing money, no longer wants to own the unprofitable fiat unit. Reports of deadlocked talks sent fiat shares down 1.2% on tuesday, after monday's 4% gain on hopes of a payoff. The us firm is thought to be offering about $2bn (£1.06bn) to extricate itself from the arrangement. It has argued the deal was voided by fiat's decision to sell off fiat's finance arm and halve gm's stake via a capital-raising effort. The 2000 deal resulted from a race between gm and daimlerchrysler to ally with fiat.
polished:
Deadline Approaches for Fiat-GM Deal

Fiat and General Motors (GM) must reach an agreement by midnight on 1 February to resolve their disagreement over a potential takeover. At this deadline, Fiat gains the right to sell its car division to GM, as outlined in the alliance formed in 2000. GM, which is facing losses in its European operations, no longer wishes to own the unprofitable Fiat unit. Reports of stalled negotiations caused Fiat shares to drop 1.2% on Tuesday, following a 4% rise on Monday due to hopes of a resolution. It is believed the U.S. firm is offering approximately $2 billion (£1.06 billion) to end the agreement. GM contends the deal was nullified by Fiat's decision to sell off its finance arm and reduce GM's stake through a capital-raising initiative. The 2000 deal was part of a competition between GM and DaimlerChrysler to partner with Fiat.

original: Cardinal criticises iraq war cost billions of pounds spent on conflict in iraq and in the middle east should have been used to reduce poverty, cardinal cormac murphy-o'connor has said. The head of the catholic church in england and wales made the comments on bbc radio 4 and will re-iterate his stance in his christmas midnight mass. The cardinal used a christmas message to denounce the war in iraq as a "terrible" waste of money. He and the archbishop of canterbury have both spoken out about the war. Speaking on bbc radio 4's thought for the day slot, he criticised the fact that "billions" have been spent on war, instead of being used to bring people "out of dire poverty and malnourishment and disease". The cardinal said 2005 should be the year for campaigning to "make history poverty".
polished: Cardinal criticizes Iraq war cost, stating billions of pounds spent on conflict in Iraq and the Middle East should have been used to reduce poverty, Cardinal Cormac Murphy-O'Connor has said. The head of the Catholic Church in England and Wales expressed these views on BBC Radio 4 and will reiterate his stance during his Christmas Midnight Mass. The cardinal used his Christmas message to denounce the war in Iraq as a "terrible" waste of money. Both he and the Archbishop of Canterbury have spoken out against the war. Speaking on BBC Radio 4's Thought for the Day slot, he criticized the fact that "billions" have been spent on war instead of being used to alleviate "dire poverty, malnourishment, and disease." The cardinal said 2005 should be the year for campaigning to "make poverty history.

original: British stars denied major oscars british hopes of winning major oscars were dashed as uk stars failed to win acting and directing prizes. Despite three nominations, mike leigh's vera drake failed to take the director or screenplay awards and there was no prize for star imelda staunton. Kate winslet also lost to best actress hilary swank, while clive owen and sophie okonedo failed to win best supporting actor awards. The uk's andrea arnold won the short film award for her gritty drama wasp. Arnold, who presented children's television shows number 73 and motormouth in the 1980s, said it was "totally overwhelming" to win. Wasp tells the story of a single mother living on the breadline, beating films by fellow uk nominees gary mckendry and ashvin kumar.
polished: British stars were denied major Oscars as UK talents failed to win in the acting and directing categories. Despite three nominations, Mike Leigh's "Vera Drake" did not receive the director or screenplay awards, and no prize was awarded to star Imelda Staunton. Kate Winslet lost the Best Actress award to Hilary Swank, while Clive Owen and Sophie Okonedo did not win Best Supporting Actor awards. However, the UK's Andrea Arnold won the Short Film Award for her gritty drama "Wasp." Arnold, who presented children's television shows "Number 73" and "Motormouth" in the 1980s, said it was "totally overwhelming" to win. "Wasp" tells the story of a single mother living on the breadline, winning over films by fellow UK nominees Gary McKendry and Ashvin Kumar.

original: Halloween writer debra hill dies screenwriter and producer debra hill, best known for her work on the 70s horror classic halloween, has died in los angeles aged 54. Hill, who had been suffering from cancer, co-wrote the 1978 film, which starred jamie lee curtis as a babysitter terrorised by a psychopath. Directed by john carpenter, it made over $60m (£31.3m) worldwide - a record for independent film at that time. Hill also worked with carpenter on escape from new york and the fog. Born in new jersey, hill began her career as a production assistant and worked her way through the ranks, becoming an assistant director and second-unit director before she began collaborating with carpenter. She was regarded by many as a pioneering woman in film, taking on jobs in the 70s that were more commonly taken by men.
polished: Debra Hill, a renowned writer and producer best known for her work on the 70s horror classic "Halloween," has passed away in Los Angeles at the age of 54. Hill, who had been battling cancer, co-wrote the 1978 film, which starred Jamie Lee Curtis as a babysitter terrorized by a psychopath. Directed by John Carpenter, it grossed over $60 million (£31.3 million) worldwide—a record for an independent film at that time. Hill also collaborated with Carpenter on "Escape from New York" and "The Fog." Born in New Jersey, she began her career as a production assistant, rising through the ranks to become an assistant director before collaborating with Carpenter. Hill was regarded by many as a pioneering woman in film, taking on roles in the 70s that were typically held by men.

original: Broadband fuels online expression fast web access is encouraging more people to express themselves online, research suggests. A quarter of broadband users in britain regularly upload content and have personal sites, according to a report by uk think-tank demos. It said that having an always-on, fast connection is changing the way people use the internet. More than five million households in the uk have broadband and that number is growing fast. The demos report looked at the impact of broadband on people's net habits. It found that more than half of those with broadband logged on to the web before breakfast. One in five even admitted to getting up in the middle of the night to browse the web. More significantly, argues the report, broadband is encouraging people to take a more active role online.
polished: Broadband is fueling online expression, with fast web access encouraging more people to express themselves online, research suggests. A quarter of broadband users in Britain regularly upload content and have personal sites, according to a report by UK think-tank Demos. They state that having an always-on, fast connection is changing how people use the internet. More than five million households in the UK have broadband, and that number is rapidly increasing. The Demos report examined broadband's impact on people's internet habits. It found that more than half logged on before breakfast. One in five even admitted to waking up in the middle of the night to browse. More significantly, the report argues, broadband is encouraging people to take a more active role online.

original: Yukos heading back to us courts russian oil and gas company yukos is due in a us court on thursday as it continues to fight for its survival. The firm is in the process of being broken up by russian authorities in order to pay a $27bn (£14bn) tax bill. Yukos filed for bankruptcy in the us, hoping to use international business law to halt the forced sale of its key oil production unit, yuganskneftegas. The unit was however sold for $9.4bn to state oil firm rosneft but only after the state auction had been disrupted. Yukos lawyers now say the auction violated us bankruptcy law. The company and its main shareholders have vowed to go after any company that buys its assets, using all and every legal means.
polished: Yukos is returning to U.S. courts as the Russian oil and gas company continues its fight for survival. The firm is undergoing a breakup by Russian authorities to pay a $27 billion (£14 billion) tax bill. Yukos filed for bankruptcy in the U.S., aiming to use international business law to stop the forced sale of its key oil production unit, Yuganskneftegas. However, the unit was sold for $9.4 billion to state oil firm Rosneft, despite disruptions during the state auction. Yukos lawyers argue that the auction violated U.S. bankruptcy law. The company and its main shareholders are determined to pursue any buyer of its assets through all available legal means.

original: Voters flock to blog awards site voting is under way for the annual bloggies which recognise the best web blogs - online spaces where people publish their thoughts - of the year. Nominations were announced on sunday, but traffic to the official site was so heavy that the website was temporarily closed because of too many visitors. Weblogs have been nominated in 30 categories, from the top regional blog, to the best-kept-secret blog. Blogs had a huge year, with a top us dictionary naming "blog" word of 2004. Technorati, a blog search engine, tracks about six million blogs and says that more than 12,000 are added daily. A blog is created every 5.8 seconds, according to us research think-tank pew internet and american life, but less than 40% of the total are updated at least once every two months.
polished: Voters are flocking to the Blog Awards site as voting is underway for the annual Bloggies, which recognize the year's best web blogs—online spaces where people publish their thoughts. Nominations were announced on Sunday, but the official site experienced such heavy traffic that it had to temporarily close due to the influx of visitors. Weblogs have been nominated in 30 categories, ranging from the top regional blog to the best-kept-secret blog. Blogs had a significant year, especially with a top U.S. dictionary naming "blog" the word of 2004. Technorati, a blog search engine, tracks about six million blogs, noting that more than 12,000 are added daily. According to U.S. research think-tank Pew Internet and American Life, a blog is created every 5.8 seconds. However, less than 40% are updated at least once every two months.

original: Chinese dam firm 'defies beijing' the china three gorges project corp is refusing to obey a government order to stop construction of one of its giant dams, the chinese state press has said. The builder of the three gorges dam is continuing work on the sister xiluodu dam, said the beijing news. The xiluodu dam is one of 30 such large-scale construction projects called to a halt because of a lack of proper environmental checks. The beijing news said the company may instead choose to pay a fine. The firm has also ignored orders to stop construction at two of its other projects - the three gorges underground power plant and the three gorges project electrical power supply plant. So far, only 22 of the 30 construction projects targeted by china's state environmental protection agency (sepa) for having not carried out mandatory environmental impact assessments have complied with its shutdown order.
polished: The Chinese state press has reported that the China Three Gorges Project Corp is defying a government order to halt construction of one of its massive dams. Despite directives, the builder of the Three Gorges Dam is continuing work on the Xiluodu Dam, as revealed by the Beijing News. The Xiluodu Dam is among 30 significant construction projects suspended due to inadequate environmental checks. According to the Beijing News, the company might opt to pay a fine instead. Additionally, the firm has ignored orders to cease construction at two other sites—the Three Gorges underground power plant and the Three Gorges project electrical power supply plant. So far, only 22 of the 30 projects identified by China's State Environmental Protection Agency (SEPA) for lacking mandated environmental impact assessments have adhered to the shutdown order.

original: Man city 0-2 man utd manchester united reduced chelsea's premiership lead to nine points after a scrappy victory over manchester city. Wayne rooney met gary neville's cross to the near post with a low shot, which went in via a deflection off richard dunne, to put united ahead. Seven minutes later, the unfortunate dunne hooked a volley over david james' head and into his own net. Steve mcmanaman wasted city's best chance when he shot wide from three yards in the first half. In the opening 45 minutes united had looked unlikely to earn the win they needed to maintain any chance of catching chelsea in the title race. Their approach play was more laboured than patient and they managed to fashion just one chance - a paul scholes header over the bar.
polished: Manchester United reduced Chelsea's Premier League lead to nine points with a scrappy 2-0 victory over Manchester City. Wayne Rooney met Gary Neville's cross to the near post with a low shot, which deflected off Richard Dunne to put United ahead. Seven minutes later, the unfortunate Dunne accidentally volleyed over David James' head into his own net. Steve McManaman wasted City's best chance when he shot wide from three yards in the first half. In the opening 45 minutes, United looked unlikely to secure the win they needed to challenge Chelsea for the title. Their approach was more labored than patient, and they crafted just one chance—a Paul Scholes header over the bar.

original: Wales 'must learn health lessons' the new health minister for wales says there are lessons to learn from england in tackling waiting lists. Dr brian gibbons, on his first full day in the job after jane hutt was sacked, admitted "big challenges" but insisted the "essentials" were in place. But both plaid cymru and the liberal democrats said dr gibbons needed to change policy. Meanwhile ms hutt defended her record, saying waiting times and lists were "only 10% of the health agenda. Dr gibbons, who was a gp in blaengwynfi, in the upper afan valley, before becoming am for aberavon, said nhs staff wanted a period of consolidation after "tremendous change and reform". One of the biggest problems which had faced ms hutt during her five-and-a-half years as the assembly's first health minister was the length of waiting lists in wales.
polished: The new health minister for Wales, Dr. Brian Gibbons, acknowledges there are important lessons to learn from England in addressing waiting lists. On his first full day in office, following the departure of Jane Hutt, Dr. Gibbons admitted there are "big challenges" but emphasized that the "essentials" are in place. However, both Plaid Cymru and the Liberal Democrats asserted that Dr. Gibbons needs to change policy. Meanwhile, Ms. Hutt defended her record, stating that waiting times and lists composed "only 10% of the health agenda." Dr. Gibbons, formerly a GP in Blaengwynfi in the upper Afan Valley, and now AM for Aberavon, mentioned that NHS staff desire a period of consolidation after "tremendous change and reform." Ms. Hutt faced significant challenges with the length of waiting lists during her tenure.

original: Ferguson hails man utd's resolve manchester united's alex ferguson has praised his players' gutsy performance in the 1-0 win at aston villa. "that was our hardest away game of the season and it was a fantastic game of football, end-to-end with lots of good passing," said the old trafford boss. "we showed lots of character and guts and we weren't going to lose. "i look at that fixture and think we've been there and won, while arsenal and chelsea have yet to come and villa may have some players back when they do." ferguson also hailed senior stars ryan giggs and roy keane, who came off the bench for the injured john o'shea. "roy came on and brought a bit of composure to the midfield which we needed and which no other player has got.
polished:
Ferguson Hails Man Utd's Resolve  

Manchester United's Alex Ferguson praised his players' gutsy performance in the 1-0 win at Aston Villa. "That was our hardest away game of the season, and it was a fantastic game of football, end-to-end with lots of good passing," said the Old Trafford boss. "We showed lots of character and weren't going to lose."  

He reflected on the fixture, noting, "We've been there and won, while Arsenal and Chelsea have yet to come, and Villa may have some players back when they do."  

Ferguson also commended senior stars Ryan Giggs and Roy Keane, who came off the bench for the injured John O'Shea. "Roy came on and brought composure to the midfield, which no other player has.

original: Singer's film to show at festival a documentary which takes a candid look at the life of chart-topping singer george michael will be shown at this year's berlin film festival. A different story will screen in the panorama section of the festival, which runs from 10-20 february. It features the singer talking about both his career and his personal life, from his days in wham! through to more recent events. Michael will attend the festival to introduce the screening on 16 february. Director southan morris and executive producer andy stephens will also attend the festival. The 93 minute film will see michael discussing his early days in wham! along with his later career, including his legal battles with record label sony and his stance against the iraq war and american politics.
polished: A documentary that offers a candid look at the life of chart-topping singer George Michael will be showcased at this year's Berlin Film Festival. Titled "A Different Story," it will be screened in the Panorama section of the festival, which runs from February 10-20. The film features Michael discussing his career and personal life, from his Wham! days to more recent events. Michael will attend the festival to introduce the screening on February 16. Director Southan Morris and executive producer Andy Stephens will also be present. The 93-minute film includes Michael's reflections on his early Wham! days, his later career, legal battles with record label Sony, and his opposition to the Iraq War and American politics.

original: Downloads enter us singles chart digital music downloads are being included in the main us singles chart for the first time. Billboard's hot 100 chart now incorporates data from sales of music downloads, previously only assigned to a separate download chart. Green day's boulevard of broken dreams is currently number two in billboard's pop chart, and tops its digital chart. Download sales are due to be incorporated into the uk singles chart later this year. Digital sales in the us are already used to compile billboard's hot digital sales chart. They will now be tallied with sales of physical singles and airplay information to make up its new hot 100 chart. Its second new chart - the pop 100 - also combines airplay, digital and physical sales but confines its airplay information to us radio stations which play chart music.
polished: Digital music downloads are now being included in the main US singles chart for the first time. Billboard's Hot 100 chart incorporates data from sales of music downloads, which were previously confined to a separate download chart. Green Day's "Boulevard of Broken Dreams" is currently number two in Billboard's pop chart and tops the digital chart. Download sales will also be included in the UK singles chart later this year. In the US, digital sales already contribute to Billboard's Hot Digital Sales chart. Now, they will be combined with physical singles sales and airplay data to form the new Hot 100 chart. The second new chart, the Pop 100, also combines airplay, digital, and physical sales but limits its airplay information to US radio stations that play chart music.

original: Anti-spam laws bite spammer hard the net's self-declared spam king is seeking bankruptcy protection. Scott richter, the man behind optinrealbig.com and billions of junk mail messages, said lawsuits had forced the company into chapter 11. Optinrealbig was fighting several legal battles, most notably against microsoft, which is pushing for millions of dollars in damages. The company said filing for chapter 11 would help it try to resolve its legal problems but still keep trading. Listed as the third biggest spammer in the world by junk mail watchdog spamhaus, optinrealbig was sued in december 2003 for sending mail messages that violated anti-spam laws. The lawsuit was brought by microsoft and new york attorney general eliot spitzer who alleged that mr richter and his accomplices sent billions of spam messages through 514 compromised net addresses in 35 countries.
polished: Anti-spam laws have hit a major spammer hard, as the internet's self-proclaimed "spam king" seeks bankruptcy protection. Scott Richter, the individual behind OptinRealBig.com and billions of spam messages, stated that lawsuits have driven the company to file for Chapter 11. OptinRealBig was embroiled in several legal disputes, most prominently with Microsoft, which is seeking millions in damages. The company believes that Chapter 11 will aid in resolving its legal issues while allowing it to continue operations. Ranked as the third-largest spammer globally by the junk mail watchdog Spamhaus, OptinRealBig was sued in December 2003 for sending emails that breached anti-spam laws. The lawsuit was initiated by Microsoft and New York Attorney General Eliot Spitzer, alleging that Richter and his accomplices sent billions of spam messages through 514 compromised addresses in 35 countries.

original: Arnesen denies rift with santini tottenham sporting director frank arnesen has denied that coach jacques santini resigned because of a clash of personalities at white hart lane. There had been newspaper speculation that santini had felt undermined by arnesen's role at the club. "it is absolutely not true," arnesen told bbc radio five live. "there is only one thing that made him resign and that is his own personal problems.
